Posts.Content: has anyone heard anything about this? i've been diagnosed now with high cholesterol and the oncologist said there's some studies with promise that an added benefit could be the statin drugs interfere with cancer cell growth and possibly help against reoccurrence. anyone know about this?
Posts.Title: Statin Drugs Helping a Reoccurrence

Posts.Content: I'm estrogen positive(had breast cancer in 98 followed by bilat mastectomies, chemo, reconstruction, complete hysterectomy and five years of tamoxifen/aromosin). now, i'm trying to decide what to do to decrease my reoccurence chances. have just found out i have very high cholesterol and osteoporsis for 3 years. just wondered if anyone knows about taking the bio when you re estrogen positive. my onc instructed me to avoid vit E and soy but when i call about things like this the nurse says to make my own decisions now. easier said than done.
Posts.Title: Bioresponse Dim After Conventional Treatment

Posts.Content: thanks so much for your imput. I think i'm gonna give it a try. i'm avoiding anything that mimic's estrogen so i think it's worth the try. my nodes were clear but i had 3 different types of cancer. i didn't have radiation because i started reconstruction at the same time. the implants didn't work out. the first one encapsilated and ruptured and then in oct i got an infection in the implant area and almost died from it. did you do reconstruction? i have lymphedema on the cancer side but not the other side. i'm so happy to hear how well you are doing. having moved to the yearly visit with the oncologist feels like my security blanket is gone. have you experienced osteoporosis or high cholesterol?
Posts.Title: Bioresponse Dim After Conventional Treatment
